summary: The 'Resources for Victims of Gun Violence Act of 2025' establishes a Federal Advisory Council to Support Victims of Gun Violence. This council, composed of various federal agency heads and appointed victims/victim assistance professionals, will assess needs, gather information, and disseminate resources to help victims of gun violence. The council's duties include a literature review, report generation with best practices, and a 2-year follow-up report. It also involves public input and will sunset five years after enactment, with no additional funding authorized.
